content: single_crochet in next 12 st join left foot by working one single_crochet into marked 7th st single_crochet in next 19 st single_crochet into marked 17th st on right foot single_crochet in next 7 st 40 st sew gap of 4 single_crochet together with yarn from left foot 2 continue with body round 10 11 2 rounds single_crochet in each st around 40 st round 12 decrease single_crochet in next 8 st 4 times 36 st round 13 decrease single_crochet in next 4 st 6 times 30 st round 14 17 4 rounds single_crochet in each st around 30 st round 18 decrease single_crochet in next 3 st 6 times 24 st round 19 22 4 rounds single_crochet in each st around 24 st round 23 decrease single_crochet in next 2 st 6 times 18 st round 24 25 2 rounds single_crochet in each st around 18 st fo leaving enough yarn to sew head and body together head and ears two versions this is the head i made the first time which needs some embroidery to give the grey fuzzy face effect head version 1 start from top using brown yarn round 1 chain 2 work 6 single_crochet into 1st chain - 6 st round 2 2 single_crochet in each st around - 12 st round 3 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 6 times - 18 st round 4 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 2 st 6 times - 24 st round 5 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 3 st 6 times - 30 st round 6 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next 4 st 6 times - 36 st round 7 12 6 rounds single_crochet in each st around 36 st fit eyes between rounds 7 and 8 round 13 decrease single_crochet in next 4 st 6 times 30 st round 14 decrease single_crochet in next 3 st 6 times 24 st round 15 decrease single_crochet in next 2 st 6 times 18 st fo partially stuff the head to give it some shape and then embroider the features it helps to look at photos of the real wicket use 3 brown yarn or thread for the nose and mouth and white for the teeth if wished i did the nose with horizontal lines ending with 3 separate parts to give the effect of nostrils for the mouth i did 2 horizontal lines then embroidered vertically over each of them to make the lips the teeth are little vertical lines use the light grey/brown yarn to embroider little lines to look like the fur on wicket s face stuff more firmly ears version 1 make 2 using brown yarn round 1 chain 2 work 5 single_crochet into 1st chain - 5 st round 2 2 single_crochet in each st around - 10 st round 3 5 3 rounds single_crochet in each st around 10 st fo leaving enough yarn to sew to head use the light grey/brown
